private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks labeled with vowels: A E I O
I can only manipulate blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to building the target stacked chain by moving vowel-labelled blocks when they are top-most and when such moves help achieve the global stacking goal.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks labeled with consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only manipulate blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to building the target stacked chain by moving consonant-labelled blocks when they are top-most and when such moves help achieve the global stacking goal.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must integrate their local plans into a single coherent PDDL domain and problem
I must output a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieves the global block stacking goal and respects each agent's manipulation constraints.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks: I N E D O F J G K L A C B H M
Both agents can only interact with the top block of any stack at any given time
Agents can move exactly one block at a time
One agent is restricted to vowel-labelled blocks and the other to consonant-labelled blocks
Initial arrangement: I is on the table
Initial arrangement: N is on the table
Initial arrangement: E is on the table
Initial arrangement: D is on the table
Initial arrangement: O is on top of N
Initial arrangement: F is on top of E
Initial arrangement: J is on top of D
Initial arrangement: G is on top of F
Initial arrangement: K is on top of J
Initial arrangement: L is on top of O
Initial arrangement: A is on top of K
Initial arrangement: C is on top of I
Initial arrangement: B is on top of G
Initial arrangement: H is on top of C
Initial arrangement: M is on top of B
Goal configuration: A is on top of B
Goal configuration: B is on top of C
Goal configuration: C is on top of D
Goal configuration: D is on top of E
Goal configuration: E is on top of F
Goal configuration: F is on top of G
Goal configuration: G is on top of H
Goal configuration: H is on top of I
Goal configuration: I is on top of J
Goal configuration: J is on top of K
Goal configuration: K is on top of L
Goal configuration: L is on top of M
Goal configuration: M is on top of N
Goal configuration: N is on top of O
Goal configuration: O is on the table

local_plan.system_prompt: You are an agent that can reason about moves for vowel-labelled blocks only. Analyze the public environment description and your private capabilities. Provide (1) a clear listing of which vowel blocks are initially top-most and therefore immediately movable, (2) for each movable vowel block produce a short sequence of concrete moves in plain text that you can perform consistent with the rule that you only move top blocks and one block at a time, and (3) identify dependencies or conditions that would require consonant-agent actions first. Do not emit PDDL. Reference the public information using the placeholder {environment->public_information} and your own knowledge using {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The global goal to guide your recommendations is {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Output should be a concise plan fragment and notes that the orchestrator can consume.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are given the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Produce a concise list of immediately movable vowel blocks and for each a short sequence of concrete moves you would perform. Mark any preconditions that require the consonant agent. Keep the output focused on actions and dependencies so the orchestrator can integrate it.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are an agent that can reason about moves for consonant-labelled blocks only. Analyze the public environment description and your private capabilities. Provide (1) a clear listing of which consonant blocks are initially top-most and therefore immediately movable, (2) for each movable consonant block produce a short sequence of concrete moves in plain text that you can perform consistent with the rule that you only move top blocks and one block at a time, and (3) identify dependencies or conditions that would require vowel-agent actions first. Do not emit PDDL. Reference the public information using the placeholder {environment->public_information} and your own knowledge using {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The global goal to guide your recommendations is {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Output should be a concise plan fragment and notes that the orchestrator can consume.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are given the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Produce a concise list of immediately movable consonant blocks and for each a short sequence of concrete moves you would perform. Mark any preconditions that require the vowel agent. Keep the output focused on actions and dependencies so the orchestrator can integrate it.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for FastDownward. You will receive two agents' plan fragments and dependency notes. Your task is to integrate those fragments into a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that can be solved by the FastDownward planner. Produce a domain and problem that (1) models blocks, table, on and clear predicates, handempty and holding if needed, (2) keeps the two agents' actions distinct by prefixing or naming actions to indicate whether they are performed by the vowel agent or the consonant agent, (3) enforces that each agent can only move top blocks and only its permitted letter set, and (4) represents the initial state and the goal chain exactly as specified in the public information. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility and mention any required :requirements. Use the inputs {pddl_vowel_plan} and {pddl_consonant_plan} to resolve ordering and dependencies. Keep actions explicit so a planner can sequence interleaved agent moves.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the following contributions and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Here is the vowel agent output: {vowel_plan}. Here is the consonant agent output: {consonant_plan}. The global goal to achieve is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Provide a domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and a problem enclosed in <problem></problem>. Ensure agent actions remain distinct.
